messages.content: We face a choice on Thursday. It's between investment in our future with Labour or five more years of Tory government- and in Manchester, we know that means more cuts to our schools, local government and the NHS. Our city has been hit hard since 2010 under the Conservatives and Liberal Democrats.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support Labourâ€™s plans to invest in 10,000 extra police officers
Back Labour funding for our NHS
Oppose a Tory 'hard Brexit', which would fail to protect jobs and safeguard rights
Back Labour plans for a million new homes and to give renters new rights

mentions.candidate: I've been proud to work hard serving this area since you elected me in 2015.
mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: The Tories and Liberal Democrats can't be trusted to stand up for Manchester.

issues.brexitEurope: Oppose a Tory 'hard Brexit', which would fail to protect jobs and safeguard rights
issues.education: Greater Manchester Police has lost a quarter of officers
issues.governance: More cuts to our schools, local government and the NHS
issues.health: Back Labour funding for our NHS

housing.content: Back Labour plans for a million new homes and to give renters new rights

politicalExperience.achievements: Not afraid to stand up for the interests of this area even when it was difficult; dealt with over 10,000 casework enquiries.

contactInformation.address: Unit 1, Withington Fire Station, 560 Wilmslow Road, M20 4AW

images.caption: Jeff Smith, Labour Parliamentary Candidate for Manchester Withington

leaflet.additionalNotes: Promoted and published by James Wilson, on behalf of Jeff Smith, both at 57 Kingslea Road, Manchester, M20 4UB. Printed by MLP, Wesley Centre, Royce Road, Manchester, M15 5BP.
